thread.title: Penguins hoping more depth behind stars leads to deeper run
thread.title_full: Penguins hoping more depth behind stars leads to deeper run

author: WILL GRAVES
title: Penguins hoping more depth behind stars leads to deeper run
text:
Gene Puskar Penguins hoping more depth behind stars leads to deeper run 
FILE - In this Sept. 22, 2015, file photo, Pittsburgh Penguins' Sidney Crosby (87) and Phil Kessel (81) sit on the bench during the first period of an exhibition NHL hockey game against Carolina Hurricanes in Pittsburgh. The brooding and high-scoring forward, Kessel, earned a much-needed change of scenery after six seasons in Toronto, where he became the target of criticism for the Maple Leafs missing the playoffs five times. (AP Photo/Gene Puskar, File) Gerry Broome Penguins hoping more depth behind stars leads to deeper run 
Pittsburgh Penguins' Sidney Crosby (87) controls the puck again Carolina Hurricanes' Justin Faulk (27) during the first period of an NHL preseason hockey game in Raleigh, N.C., Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. (AP Photo/Gerry Broome) Posted: Monday, October 5, 2015 12:43 pm 
PITTSBURGH (AP) — Mike Johnston spent his first season coaching the Pittsburgh Penguins preaching the same message over and over to his talented but almost pathologically unselfish lineup:
